abstract: We discuss approximability in FPT-time for the class of \emph{subset optimization graph problems} where a feasible solution~$S$ is a subset of the vertex set of the input graph. This class encompasses many well-known problems, such as \DS, \VC, \is, \fvs. We study approximability of such problems with respect to the dual parameter $n-k$ where~$n$ is size of the vertex set and~$k$ the standard parameter. We show that under such parameterization, many of these problems, while \textbf{W[$\mathbf{\cdot}$]}-hard, admit parameterized approximation schemata.
